resources.string:
Anemia - Low healthy red blood cell count -Tiredness -Weakness -Pale -Feel faint -Shortness of breath Take iron or folic acid supplements.
Depression - Extreme sadness during pregnancy or after birth -Intense sadness -Irritability -Appetite changes Therapy, support groups, medicines
Ectopic pregnancy - A fertilized egg implants outside of the uterus, usually in the fallopian tube. -Abdominal pain -Shoulder pain -Vaginal bleeding -Dizziness Drugs or surgery used to remove the ectopic tissue
Gestational diabetes - Blood sugar levels too high during pregnancy -Extreme thirst -Extreme hunger -Fatigue Follow healthy meal plan from health care professional
Hyperemesis gravidarum- Extreme sickness during pregnancy -Nausea -Vomiting -Weight loss -Appetite loss -Dehydration -Fainting Dry bland foods and fluids or prescribed medicines
Miscarriage - Pregnancy loss from natural causes before 20 weeks -Vaginal spotting -Vaginal bleeding -Cramps -Abdominal pain -Vaginal fluid
Placenta previa - Placenta covers part or entire opening of cervix inside of the uterus -Vaginal bleeding Cut back on activity level and increase bedrest. May require hospitalization.
Placental abruption - Placenta separates from uterine wall, fetus cannot get enough oxygen -Vaginal bleeding -Cramping -Abdominal pain -Uterine tenderness In minor separation, bed rest may stop the bleeding. Severe cases can require immediate medical attention.
Preeclampsia - High blood pressure and problems with kidneys and other organs starting after 20 weeks of pregnancy -High blood pressure -Swelling -Too much protein in urine -Stomach pain -Blurred vision -Dizziness -Headaches May need medicines and bed rest at home or in hospital
Preterm labor - Going into labor 37 weeks of pregnancy -Increased vaginal discharge -Pelvic pressure -Cramping -Back pain -Contractions
Bacterial vaginosis - Vaginal infection caused by an overgrowth of bacteria normally found in the vagina -Grey or white discharge -Burning when urinating -Itching Antibiotics treat BV
Cytomegalovirus - Common virus that can cause disease in infants whose mothers are infected with CMV -Mild illness -Fever -Sore throat -Fatigue -Swollen glads Good hygiene. Antiviral drugs for infants.
Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) - Viral infection that can be passed to baby during birth. -Nausea -Vomiting -Diarrhea -Dark urine -Pale bowel movements -White eyes -Yellowing skin Lab tests and vaccination. Influenza - Common viral infection which pregnant women are susceptible to -Fever -Cough -Sore throat -Runny nose -Muscle pain -Aches -Tiredness -Vomiting -Diarrhea Vaccinations and antiviral medicine
Listeriosis - Infection with the harmful bacteria listeria, can cause early delivery or miscarriage. -Fever -Muscle aches -Chills -Diarrhea -Nausea -Severe headache -Stiff neck Avoid foods harbouring listeria, antibiotics.
Parvovirus B19 - Virus can infect the fetus, raises risk of miscarriage and can cause severe anemia -Fever -Tiredness -Rash -Painful joints -Swollen joints Blood transfusions mightt be needed for people with immune system issues or red blood cell disorders
Urinary tract infection (UTI) - Bacterial infection in urinary tract, can cause preterm labor -Burning when urinating -Frequent urination -Pelvis pain -Back pain -Stomach pain -Side pain -Shaking -Chills -Fever -Sweats
Yeast infection - Infection caused by an overgrowth of bacteria normally found in the vagina -Vaginal itch -Vaginal swelling -Vaginal redness -Vaginal burning -Painful urination -White vaginal discharge Vaginal creams and suppositories are used to treat yeast infection when pregnant.
